pages.content: Mr. Sloth| is| sleepy,| he| climbs| to| the| trunk| of| a| tree.

But| on |the |trunk,| there| are| ants| gathering| food.
“Mr. Sloth,| Mr. Sloth!
We| are| carrying| grains| to| our |ant |colony!| Could |you |please| move| away?”| - the| ants| say.

Mr. Sloth| does| not |want| to |disturb| the| ants,| so| he |leaves| the| trunk.
Mr. Sloth| is| sleepy,| he| climbs |to |a |branch| of| the |tree.

But| on| that| branch,| there |are| squirrels| collecting |nuts.
“Mr. Sloth, |Mr. Sloth!
We| are| storing| nuts| for| the |coming| winter! |We| need| to |use |this| branch! |Could |you| please| move |away?”| - the| squirrels| say.

Mr. Sloth| does| not| want |to| bother| the| squirrels, |so| he |leaves| the |branch.
Mr. Sloth| is| sleepy, |he |climbs |higher |to |a |twig |of| a |tree.

But| on| that| twig, |some| chameleons| are| hunting. 
“Mr. Sloth,| Mr. Sloth!
We| are| hunting| insects! |We |need| to| use| this| twig! |Could |you| please| move |away?” |- the| chameleons| say.

Mr. Sloth| does| not |want| to| harass| the| chameleons’| hunt,| so| he| leaves| the| twig, |climbs| back| to |the |ground! 
Mr. Sloth| is| sleepy, |but |he| doesn’t |know |where| to |sleep.

He| is| so| sleepy| that| he| cannot| go| anywhere.
 “Mr. Sloth,| oh| my| dear! 
Let’s| come| near| and| lie| on| me”| - grass| under| the| tree| says |softly.

“We| will |call| on| the| sunlight| to| warm| you
We| will |call| on| the| wind| to| sing| you| a| lullaby.
Mr. Sloth,| just |come |here, |lie| on| me |and |sleep| tight”.
Mr. Sloth| is| so |sleepy,| he |lies| down| on| the |grass.| Finally,| no| one| can| disturb| him| now. |He |slowly| falls| asleep| with| beautiful| dreams….
